remarks: The map defined by ~ df-mapd is one-to-one and onto the set of dual subspaces of functionals with closed kernels.  This shows ` M ` satisfies part of the definition of projectivity of [Baer] p. 40.  TODO: change theorems leading to this ( ~ lcfr , ~ mapdrval , ~ lclkrs , ~ lclkr ,...) to use ` T i^i ~P C ` ?  TODO: maybe get rid of $d's for ` g ` vs. ` K U W ` ,. propagate to ~ mapdrn and any others. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-2015.)
statement:
mapd1o.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
mapd1o.o $e |- O = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapd1o.m $e |- M = ( ( mapd ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapd1o.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapd1o.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` U ) $.
mapd1o.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
mapd1o.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
mapd1o.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
mapd1o.t $e |- T = ( LSubSp ` D ) $.
mapd1o.c $e |- C = { g e. F | ( O ` ( O ` ( L ` g ) ) ) = ( L ` g ) } $.
mapd1o.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
mapd1o $p |- ( ph -> M : S -1-1-onto-> ( T i^i ~P C ) ) $.
$d F g $.
$d K g $.
$d L g $.
$d O g $.
$d U g $.
$d W g $.
